History of Present Illness: 
So I saw Maria Dolores Cammarano and she continued to have significant amount of back pain more so 
on the left side she has pain that traveled down th e left lower extremity with pain diffusely over the  foot 
throughout the whole foot the knee distribution of pain is L4-L5 on the left back pain worse than her leg 
pain.. 
She had fusion and pedicle screw placed at medical side 4 and 3 and she has spondylolisthesis at L5-S1
She was started on Forteo and hoping that I give he r injections for the pain comes down she can be abl e 
to survive without pain until such a time the bone density is strong enough for her to undergo surgery
Currently she is taking Lyrica 75 mg capsule 1 tabl et by mouth twice a day and Norco 10/3 2 5 every 6 
hours when necessary for pain she is not taking any  muscle relaxant.  None 
Patient seems to also take Aricept, memantine ,and bumatanide she also takes Plavix and and she takes 
trazodone for sleep and there is no ill effect from  the combination of medication at the patient whene ver 
she has a bad cold she does use an inhaler in the f orm of albuterol sulfate 
Otherwise the patient is fully awake alert oriented  ×3 her cranial nerve examination is fully within n ormal 
limits 
She did well with appendicular cerebellar activity 
Muscle tone upper extremity within normal limits mu scle lower extremity within normal limits 
For now the patient saw Dr. Singh the patient advis ed me she does not want to change provider Henson 
she had a second opinion I would like to reiterate the rectum my recommendation to perform a facet 
injection at L5-S1 and L1-L2 and L2-L3 given the fa ct that she has screws into L3-L4 and L5 these face ts 
at L3-L4 L4-5 and L2-L3 may not be assessed through  the inferior fossae again as access L2-L3 by 
injecting injecting the superior lateral aspect of the joint that is a peri-facet injection which will  also 
anesthetize the recurrent nerve Luschka now the pat ient is safer in the surgery center the patient 
preferred to go to surgThe patient preferred to hav e the procedure done at surgery Center with sedatio n 
As far as patient's home situation the patient for now has aged with significant MRF spinal pain and 
disability due to back pain and weakness in the lef t lower extremity. 
The patient is unable given her current condition i s to care for herself she needs assistance with bat hing,
Cooking, cleaning house, and and getting a shower a t time to go to the restroom so the patient should 
have in my opinion significant MRF and social assis tant and in in the ways to sustain her survival for  now 
the family is providing 24-hour care and for the pa tient however they do not have the capability of co ntinue 
to do 24-hour care so would like to see if social s ervice can replace the services that the family is 
providing. A lumbar facet injection is recommended at L1-L2, L2-L3, L5-S1 bilateral.

to do 24-hour care so would like to see if social s ervice can replace the services that the family is 
providing. A lumbar facet injection is recommended at L1-L2, L2-L3, L5-S1 bilateral.

Ms.Maria does not wish to pursue a second opinion. 
Ms.Maria  would like to proceed with the procedures  with Dr. Farrukh. 
Ms.Maria  does not wish to have the procedure in th e office using ultrasound 
Ms.Maria  would like to have the procedure done in the surgery center under anesthesia. 
Ms.Maria  expresses a preference for having the fac et injection procedure done in a surgery center wit h 
administration of anesthesia. She declines rhizotom y and does not want a second opinion regarding pain  
management or facet injections. 
Recommend Repeat Therapeutic Facet Block under Fluo roscopic Guidance.  The patient reports greatly 
increasing pain over the past several weeks. Pain i s rated at 8/10. The reported pain is sharp, shooti ng, 
and stabbing in nature and located across the lower  back and at the sacroiliac joint, with associated 
radicular symptoms of sharp pain, shooting pain, an d stabbing pain, radiating to the right buttock, le ft 
buttock, right leg, and left leg. The patient has h ad previous conservative treatment and previous 
treatment with physical therapy and medication, inc luding treatment with oral steroids and lumbar 
exercises.  Injections in the past have provided  8 0% relief of symptoms lasting greater than three to  four 
months.  
Radio Frequency Ablation in 4 out of 5 patients cau ses atrophy in the multifidus muscles, which will 
predispose the patient to have recurrent back pain sooner. 
In addition, the rhizotomy is destructive to the ne rve supply vs steroids are anti-inflammatory. 
Data indicates an increased risk of segmental insta bility with Radio Frequency Ablations. 
Electronically signed by Jenette Arias on 04/30/202 5 at 10:57 AM
